com.oracle.tools.runtime
Class AbstractApplicationSchema<A extends Application<A>,S extends ApplicationSchema<A,S>>

java.lang.Object
  com.oracle.tools.runtime.AbstractApplicationSchema<A,S>
All Implemented Interfaces:
ApplicationSchema<A,S>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractJavaApplicationSchema, SimpleApplicationSchema
public abstract class AbstractApplicationSchema<A extends Application<A>,S extends ApplicationSchema<A,S>>
extends Object
implements ApplicationSchema<A,S>

An AbstractApplicationSchema is a base implementation of an ApplicationSchema.

Copyright (c) 2011. All Rights Reserved. Oracle Corporation.
Oracle is a registered trademark of Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates.

Author:
Brian Oliver

setIsInherited

public S setIsInherited(boolean isInherited)
Sets whether the environment and settings from the currently executing process should be inherited when producing the Application from this ApplicationSchema.

Parameters:
isInherited - true if the ApplicationSchema should inherit the environment and settings from the currently executing process or false if a clean/empty environment should be used (containing only those settings defined by this ApplicationSchema)
Returns:
the ApplicationSchema (so that we can perform method chaining)

isInherited

public boolean isInherited()
Determines if the settings and environment variables for the ApplicationSchema should be inherited from the process in which the ApplicationSchema was created.

Specified by:
isInherited in interface ApplicationSchema<A extends Application<A>,S extends ApplicationSchema<A,S>>
Returns:
true if the settings are inherited

getDefaultTimeout

public long getDefaultTimeout()
Obtains the default duration to used for Application timeouts.

Many programs require timeouts when accessing resources, especially those that are remote or may require waiting for some period of time. In those circumstances, the default timeout is used, unless of course an explicit timeout is specified.

Specified by:
getDefaultTimeout in interface ApplicationSchema<A extends Application<A>,S extends ApplicationSchema<A,S>>
Returns:
the timeout duration (measured in #getTimeoutUnits())

getLifecycleInterceptors

public Iterable<LifecycleEventInterceptor<A>> getLifecycleInterceptors()
Obtains the LifecycleEventInterceptors that the ApplicationSchema will attach to Applications produced by the said ApplicationSchema.

LifecycleEventInterceptors are typically used by Applications and ApplicationBuilders to raise LifecycleEvents pertaining to the life-cycle of an Application.

Specified by:
getLifecycleInterceptors in interface ApplicationSchema<A extends Application<A>,S extends ApplicationSchema<A,S>>
Returns:
the LifecycleEventInterceptors

addLifecycleInterceptor

Parameters:
interceptor - the LifecycleEventInterceptor
Returns:
the ApplicationSchema (so that we can perform method chaining)
